TopicTitle: What the ESRB Rating Pending Means?

Articles.Content: For and ESRB Rating to be pending, it appears the game has to be in a finished state (or at least the component that is being rated, like multiplayer). This seems to suggest KSP 2 is nearing completion, and possibly release.

Yep!

It means that the game is finished enough to the point that it's playable and testable so the ESRB can dig into every inch of the game.
It's coming ;')
We can agree that the levels of hype are unprecedented!
Didn't it always have that rating though? I see it in feature video 1

5 minutes ago, Minmus Taster said:

Didn't it always have that rating though? I see it in feature video 1

Actually, now that I check, it's in all the feature videos.

But I think this is the first time it's appeared in a Show and Tell, so... there's that? Maybe?
Rating Pending was displayed in the first few seconds of the cinematic announce trailer, too, so only the fact that it's in a Show and Tell is really new. I'm not sure how much that really tells us.

To me it feels like the difference here was that this Show & Tell was more formal. It had the rating pending, the KSP2 screen at the end, and was shown on other platforms besides the forums. In the past, I believe it was only the forums (maybe also reddit?) that were getting the S&T's on Fridays, while the rest got it the following Monday or Tuesday. But this time it was on Twitter also. I'm assuming it was on other platforms as well, but I haven't looked. 

I don't know what it means, except maybe PD and/or T2 wanted less S&T's and the fewer ones that are given are more presentable and official?
It literally means that the rating is pending, because it is pending. That is it. Means literally nothing else.
we are so starved for any news on a potential release date lol

12 minutes ago, Greenfire32 said:

we are so starved for any news on a potential release date lol

How everyone acts after the KSP 2 team doesn't post for over an hour:

I'm pretty sure, "rating pending," simply means it hasn't been submitted yet. You can register a title with ESRB long, long before it's finished enough for a submission.

Edit: Per ESRB, Rating Pending (RP):

Quote

Not yet assigned a final ESRB rating. Appears only in advertising, marketing and promotional materials related to a physical (e.g., boxed) video game that is expected to carry an ESRB rating, and should be replaced by a game's rating once it has been assigned.

 

Edited January 30, 2022 by K^2
